result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell B Vogelman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations by the due date.  Failure to pay will result in a 30 day commitment to RCJ for contempt.

AMENDED 03-11-2014 - THE CONDITION OF SCRAM IS TO BE REMOVED AND IN ITS PLACE, DEFENDANT IS TO BE PLACED ON GPS MONITORING. EXCEPTIONS TO GPS SHALL BE ATTENDING COURT DATES, MEETING WITH HIS ATTORNEY, AN VERIFIABLE JOB INTERVIEWS AND/OR EMPLOYMENT.

**AMENDED 06-10-2014 - DEFENDANT MAY WORK FOR VECTOR COMPANY FROM THE HOURS OF 8 AM TO 4 PM MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. ALL OTHER TIMES AND DATES DEFENDANT MUST BE AT HOME. DEFENDANT MUST KEEP A LOG AS TO WHERE HE GOES FOR SAID EMPLOYMENT AND PROVIDE SAME TO ZCI ON A WEEKLY BASIS.

AMENDED 08/22/2014 - GPS MAY BE REMOVED. DEFENDANT MUST ATTEND 3 SELF HELP GROUPS PER WEEK AND BRING SIGNED PROOF OF ATTENDANCE TO ZCI WEEKLY.
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mitchell B Vogelman in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Upon plea to 14CF289, Ct 5, bal DRI. State recommends probation, ss on amount. 14CF848, Pl to 2 BJ, 3rd BJ DRI. Agreed not to issue BJ from June, 2014. The State will be asking for stayed jail time. Parties free to argue.

finding of guilt

Defense is asking that bond be modified to allow defendant to work as a car salesman and remove GPS or allow deft to work in said employment. The State indicates that the State agreed to said request before and that's when deft picked up bail jumping charges. The State objects.

BTC: guilty. PSI ordered.  Bond to be modified - deft is to go to 3 self help groups per week. Deft must bring signed proof that he attends and he must provide proof to ZCI. GPS to be removed. Other conditions remain.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mitchell B Vogelman in court with attorney Erin J Larsen.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense indicates there is some investigation ongoing and has been fruitful. The defense indicates that this case is most likely going to be set for trial. The State asks for bond to be increased to $2,500.00 cash.  The Court is in receipt of a ZCI report with violations.
Defense indicates that defendant IS employed and his employer will email ZCI with verification of employment. Defense is asking that instead of GPS, the Court simply impose a curfew. Defense indiates that deft has business meetings at Country Springs Hotel in Pewaukee.

Preliminary hearing on February 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
